Detailed Description

DAZ Studio implementation of property links (aka ERC).

This numeric controller implements an algorithm that is based on the value of another property. There are six formulas which correspond to the ERCType of the object - the default ERCType is ERCDeltaAdd. The formulas are:

  • ERCDeltaAdd: f(v) = v + (c * m) + a
  • ERCDivideInto: f(v) = (c / v) + a
  • ERCDivideBy: f(v) = (v / c) + a
  • ERCMultiply: f(v) = (c * v) + a
  • ERCSubtract: f(v) = v - c + a
  • ERCAdd: f(v) = v + c + a
  • ERCKeyed: f(v) = v + P(c)

Where:

  • v is the current (keyed) value of the property with the ERC Link
  • c is the current (final) value of the property that the ERC Link is driven by
  • m is an optional scalar multiplier
  • a is an optional offset (additive) value.

As an example of ERC in action, lets say that there are 3 properties A, B, and C. B is linked to A with a 'ERCDeltaAdd' DzERCLink with a multiplier of 1.0 and an additive value of 0.0. C is linked to B with a 'ERCDeltaAdd' DzERCLink with a multiplier of 2.0 and an additive value of 1.0. So, if the keyed value of A is 10.0, B is 0.0, and C is 0.0, the final values of the properties would be calculated as:

A = 10.0 B = 0.0 + (10.0 * 1.0) + 0.0 = 10.0 C = 0.0 + (10.0 * 2.0) + 1.0 = 21.0

If B and C have keyed values - for example B is 5.0 and C is 2.0 - the final property values would be calculated as:

A = 10.0 B = 5.0 + (10.0 * 1.0) + 0.0 = 15.0 C = 2.0 + (15.0 * 2.0) + 1.0 = 33.0

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzERCLink::ERCKeyInterpolation

The types of key interpolation that can be represented by a DzERCLink of the 'ERCKeyed' type.

Enumerator:
LINEAR_INTERP 

Linear interpolation between key values

CONSTANT_INTERP 

Constant interpolation between key values

TCB_INTERP 

TCB (Kochanek-Bartels) Spline interpolation between key values

enum DzERCLink::ERCType

The types of ERC that can be represented by this class.

Enumerator:
ERCDeltaAdd 

This type of ERC is the most common, and implements the formula f(v) = v + (c * m) + a where:

  • v is the current value of the property this ERC link resides on.
  • c is the current value of the control property that drives this ERC link
  • m is the scalar of this ERC link
  • a is the addend of this ERC link
ERCDivideInto 

This type of ERC implements the formula f(v) = (c / v) + a where:

  • v is the current value of the property this ERC link resides on.
  • c is the current value of the control property that drives this ERC link
  • a is the addend of this ERC link
ERCDivideBy 

This type of ERC implements the formula f(v) = (v / c) + a where:

  • v is the current value of the property this ERC link resides on.
  • c is the current value of the control property that drives this ERC link
  • a is the addend of this ERC link
ERCMultiply 

This type of implements the formula f(v) = (c * v) + a where:

  • v is the current value of the property this ERC link resides on.
  • c is the current value of the control property that drives this ERC link
  • a is the addend of this ERC link
ERCSubtract 

This type of ERC implements the formula f(v) = v - c + a where:

  • v is the current value of the property this ERC link resides on.
  • c is the current value of the control property that drives this ERC link
  • a is the addend of this ERC link
ERCAdd 

This type of ERC implements the formula f(v) = v + c + a where:

  • v is the current value of the property this ERC link resides on.
  • c is the current value of the control property that drives this ERC link
  • a is the addend of this ERC link
ERCKeyed 

This type of ERC is used to define value by a parametric function f(v) = v + P(c) where:

  • v is the current value of the property this ERC link resides on.
  • c is the current value of the control property that drives this ERC link
  • P is a parametric curve defined by the KeyValues array.

DzERCLink * DzERCLink::createErcLink ( DzNumericProperty *  control,
DzNumericProperty *  slave,
int  index = -1 
) [static]
Parameters:
control The property to serve as the control in the ERCLink
slave The property to serve as the slave, or controlled property, in the ERCLink
index The index location to insert the new controller in slaves controller list. If < 0 or > the current number of controllers, the controller is added to the end of the list
Returns:
A pointer to the new ERC Link if the creation was successful, NULL if creation would cause a circular link

bool DzERCLink::isActive (  )  const
Returns:
true if this expression is active and should be evaluated. The expression will still be valid (and could still be evaluated) even is it is not active, but when it is set inactive DzProperty classes and others will skip evaluating it.

void DzERCLink::setAutoOverride ( bool  onOff  ) 

Sets whether this link is automatically redirected

Parameters:

bool DzERCLink::testCircularLink ( DzNumericProperty *  control,
DzNumericProperty *  slave 
) [static]

Call before creating ERC or a Link in slave that references control. Checks the links and controllers (if any) on the source property to see if they refer to the slave property - potentially creating a 'circular' ERC link.

Returns:
true if a reference to slave was found in the ERC chain of control, otherwise false.
